title.narrative: Conservation Agriculture in Manufahi District Year 2

description.narrative:
The Organizational Objective is to adjust current cropping management towards conservation agriculture technologies and practices promoting production intensification and diversification.
In Y2 Mercy Corps will continue to support 114 smallholder men and women farmers from 6 farmers’ groups of Daisua and Holarua sucos in the testing and validation of conservation agriculture technologies and practices and mobilise an additional 100 smallholder men and women farmers from 4 farmers’ groups to replicate the validated conservation agriculture practices through the FFS approach to adaptive research and participatory extension.

The aim of this 4 year project is to promote conservation agriculture technologies and practices through adaptive research and participatory approaches (i.e. “farmer field schools” (FFSs)). During Project Year One (PY1), FAO and its implementing partners established four experimental sites (at Betano (2) and Darasula Research Stations and Natarbora Agricultural Technical School) and implemented 18 FFSs to test and validate conservation agriculture practices. Given the successes of the 18 FFSs and their demonstration plots, it has been agreed by MAF, USAID/OFDA and PMU (and endorsed by the Project Steering Committee (PSC)) that, in addition to repeating the experimentation and adaptive research work, the conservation agriculture up-scaling interventions scheduled for PY3 be brought forward and initiated in PY2 (May 2014 to May 2015) through the replication of conservation agriculture practices in 16 neighbouring sucos or sub-villages of Baucau, Ermera, Manatuto and Manufahi Districts – using trained “lead”/”champion”/”expert” farmers from completed (adaptive research) FFSs as FFS Facilitators (who would be co-ordinated by FAO, Mercy Corps and RAEBIA Timor-Lestes’ FFS Co-ordinators already in post).

participating-org.narrative: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)
